pr_title: Make encryption key explicit when reading DWRF stripes

timeline.message:
Make encryption key explicit when reading DWRF stripes

DWRF StripeInformation only contains keymetadata if the keymetadata for
this stripe would be different from the previous stripe.  However, when
we read stripes in the record reader, we exclude stripes that are not
part of the split, so we may not have info about what the keys were in
the previous stripe.  Therefore, we explicitly set the implied key
information.

timeline.author: yingsu00

replies.bodyText: intermediate encryption key.  i'll just inline this, though.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: Could you please explain why we needed this change?
timeline.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText:
I guess this was because the key was not encrypted in the manually created dwrf file such that decrypting it would fail while reading. However, @rschlussel does this affect other tests in TestDecryption? The test coverage maybe reduced if encryptKey and decryptKey were not tested. Would it make sense to make a new TestingPlainKeyEncryptionLibrary that is a subclass of TestingEncryptionLibrary?
If you think this is not the case or can be fixed later it's also ok.
replies.author: yingsu00

replies.bodyText: That's fair. I changed it because I figured the loss in test coverage would be minimal, so why have 2 classes, but I think it is still some loss in coverage, so it makes sense to keep it as it was and introduce a new class.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe stripeInformationList?  stripeInformations doesn't sound right.
timeline.author: sujay-jain

timeline.bodyText: For the first stripe, previousKeyMetadata will be empty. Could we hit some edge case there?
timeline.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText: For that case, if keyMetadata is empty, then keyMetadata and previousKeyMetadata are the same (both an empty list), so it doesn't really matter which one we use.
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: nits: maybe currentStripeInfo instead of prestoStripeInfo and previousKeyMetadata instead of previousKeysMetadata
timeline.author: sujay-jain

replies.bodyText: for currentStripeInfo vs. prestoStripeInfo, I was trying to capture that we were converting from DwrfProto.StripeInformation object to Presto's stripeInformation logic, so I'll leave that name as is.  Changed previousKeyMetadata though.
replies.author: rschlussel
